intro: Lawiella chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese lawiella, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in spring. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
